raw_response:
Looking at this pediatric developmental milestones question, I need to match each child's abilities to their appropriate age.

**First child's milestones:**
- Lifts head and chest in prone position (2-3 months)
- Tracks objects to midline (2 months)
- Hands fisted 50% of time (normal at 2 months; hands should be open most of the time by 3-4 months)
- Good feeding and voiding pattern

This profile fits **2 months**.

**Second child's milestones:**
- Rolls supine to prone (typically 4-6 months, with prone to supine coming first around 4 months)
- Transfers objects hand to hand (5-6 months)
- No words yet (normal; first words typically appear around 12 months)

This profile fits **6 months**.

**Third child's milestones:**
- Takes independent steps (typically 12-15 months)
- Recognizes names of several objects (12+ months)
- Cannot follow one-step command yet (one-step commands typically understood around 12-15 months, so this is still developing)

This profile fits **12 months**.

**Evidence quality assessment:** This is a standard, well-constructed pediatric developmental milestones question with realistic clinical scenarios and age-appropriate developmental markers. Nothing implausible or dangerous.
